column4: hello, every time I open my ubuntu 12 system, I need to go to disks and activate my swap partition, to enable the hibernate function, any advice to let it be automatically set?
how do you activate your swap partition? What command?
I open disks program then click on the external disk which have my 5G swap partition then click on 'activate swap space' button
you can add an extra line to /etc/fstab for your swap file
if your swap is on /dev/sdX, put in:
first find out where your swap partition is, and then edit /etc/fstab with alt+f2 -> gksu gedit /etc/fstab
i found this line in fstab file >>>>>> # swap was on /dev/sdb5 during installation
do i have to comment this line and write what you tell me?
that looks like your swap partition. What happens when you run the following in a terminal (ctrl + alt + t): sudo swapoff -a && sudo swapon -a
here is the result >> swapon: cannot find the device for UUID=5463df7e-58f8-423d-b37b-3de5e0ed5265
looks like you changed or moved your swap partition, and that is why it's not activated automatically
I commented the uuid by # in the first of the line and will put this line instead >> /dev/sdb5 none swap sw 0 0          is this a good idea?
if /dev/sdb5 is your swap partition: yes
yes it should be , thank you i will restart and see
thank you all work fine now
